pull.title: test: run mempool_compatibility.py even with wallet disabled
pull.body: Another functional test rewritten as proposed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20078

events.body:
The 1st commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20688/commits/f2b7cb56c8cbec9c6a2a8ec88143756974f6860f is ready to go now

I realized that I could extend the test coverage a bit, see 2nd commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20688/commits/6a1e9adeaea8a12a23ec4be5d59cec4fccd0c196. I know it's not totally related to this PR. Maybe it seems more appropriate for a test like this to go in `mempool_accept.py`, but this test-case does fit in naturally to `MempoolCompatibilityTest`, and seems a little tricky to do in `mempool_accept.py` the way that test is setup.

What do you think is the best way forward? If you want it in this PR I can squash the commits, otherwise I'll ditch the 2nd commit

Hey @instagibbs thanks for the review. How does this look? https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20688/commits/174da9f63a51747e7297949414edba6bf9d673dc.  lmk if you have any ideas on how this can be done better - I know it doesn't perfectly address your comments, but seemed like a good balance to me without adding too much code or extra stuff

better thanks, you can squash the last two commits together :+1: 

ACK otherwise
ACK bff5aca27d0d66587c0155642a9c6cd88228ed29 code review, tested with bitcoind built with the wallet and without

verification.payload:
tree 084318ec61a41faae2f18d4830183e213a502c6c
parent 143bd108ed6626405b0361c9939a8e1bf6cfc3d2
author Michael Dietz <michael.dietz@waya.ai> 1610043864 -0600
committer Michael Dietz <michael.dietz@waya.ai> 1610043864 -0600

test: run mempool_compatibility.py even with wallet disabled

events.message: test: run mempool_compatibility.py even with wallet disabled

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,18 +33,24 @@ def setup_network(self):
             None,
         ])
         self.start_nodes()
-        self.import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys()
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Test that mempool.dat is compatible between versions")
 
-        old_node = self.nodes[0]
-        new_node = self.nodes[1]
-        recipient = old_node.getnewaddress()
-        self.stop_node(1)
+        old_node, new_node = self.nodes
+        old_wallet = MiniWallet(old_node)
+        new_wallet = MiniWallet(new_node)
+
+        # Add enough mature utxos to the wallets so that all txs spend confirmed coins.
+        old_wallet.generate(1)
+        new_wallet.generate(1)
+        old_node.generate(100)
+        self.connect_nodes(0, 1)
+        self.sync_all()
 
+        self.stop_node(1)
         self.log.info("Add a transaction to mempool on old node and shutdown")
-        old_tx_hash = old_node.sendtoaddress(recipient, 0.0001)
+        old_tx_hash = old_wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=old_node)['txid']
comments.body: no need to replace this. old nodes always have a wallet

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,18 +33,24 @@ def setup_network(self):
             None,
         ])
         self.start_nodes()
-        self.import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys()
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Test that mempool.dat is compatible between versions")
 
-        old_node = self.nodes[0]
-        new_node = self.nodes[1]
-        recipient = old_node.getnewaddress()
-        self.stop_node(1)
+        old_node, new_node = self.nodes
+        old_wallet = MiniWallet(old_node)
+        new_wallet = MiniWallet(new_node)
+
+        # Add enough mature utxos to the wallets so that all txs spend confirmed coins.
comments.body: No need for this comment? There is only one inputs, so this is clear from reading the code.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,7 +68,23 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.stop_node(1)
 
         self.log.info("Move mempool.dat from new to old node")
-        os.rename(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
+        shutil.copyfile(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
+
+        # Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction.
+        # Because the nodes have not been synced, old_node will not accept unbroadcasted tx to its mempool.
comments.body: can you convert this "nodes have not been synced" statement into an assertion? May catch future test regressions, and is more self-explanatory

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -69,7 +68,23 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.stop_node(1)
 
         self.log.info("Move mempool.dat from new to old node")
-        os.rename(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
+        shutil.copyfile(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
+
+        # Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction.
comments.body:
I don't understand why this comment is here

edit: ah, because it's a coinbase output being spent? Can we convert this into an assertion?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,13 +38,15 @@ def setup_network(self):
             None,
         ])
         self.start_nodes()
-        self.import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys()
+        self.init_wallet(0)  # only import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys for old_node
comments.body: Does this line need to change? If yes, why?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,13 +38,15 @@ def setup_network(self):
             None,
         ])
         self.start_nodes()
-        self.import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys()
+        self.init_wallet(0)  # only import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys for old_node
comments.body: Good point - this change is not necessary. I got rid of it and force pushed

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,28 +55,44 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert old_tx_hash in old_node.getrawmempool()
         self.stop_node(0)
 
-        self.log.info("Move mempool.dat from old to new node")
+        self.log.info("Copy mempool.dat from old to new node")
         old_node_mempool = os.path.join(old_node.datadir, self.chain, 'mempool.dat')
         new_node_mempool = os.path.join(new_node.datadir, self.chain, 'mempool.dat')
-        os.rename(old_node_mempool, new_node_mempool)
+        shutil.copyfile(old_node_mempool, new_node_mempool)
 
         self.log.info("Start new node and verify mempool contains the tx")
         self.start_node(1)
         assert old_tx_hash in new_node.getrawmempool()
 
         self.log.info("Add unbroadcasted tx to mempool on new node and shutdown")
-        unbroadcasted_tx_hash = new_node.sendtoaddress(recipient, 0.0001)
+        unbroadcasted_tx_hash = new_wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=new_node)['txid']
         assert unbroadcasted_tx_hash in new_node.getrawmempool()
         mempool = new_node.getrawmempool(True)
         assert mempool[unbroadcasted_tx_hash]['unbroadcast']
         self.stop_node(1)
 
-        self.log.info("Move mempool.dat from new to old node")
-        os.rename(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
+        self.log.info("Copy mempool.dat from new to old node")
+        shutil.copyfile(new_node_mempool, old_node_mempool)
 
-        self.log.info("Start old node again and verify mempool contains both txs")
+        self.log.info("Start old node again and verify mempool does not contain unbroadcasted_tx_hash")
         self.start_node(0, ['-nowallet'])
         assert old_tx_hash in old_node.getrawmempool()
+        # Because the nodes haven't been synced, old_node doesn't have the block that contains the coinbase that unbroadcasted_tx spends.
+        # As coinbases are only valid in a block, and not as loose txns, unbroadcasted_tx won't pass `MemPoolAccept::PreChecks`.
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-5, "Block not found", old_node.getblock, blockhash=block_hash)
+        assert unbroadcasted_tx_hash not in old_node.getrawmempool()
comments.body: I don't understand why this test is being changed. The only change should be replacing the bitcoin core wallet with miniwallet. If you want to do additional changes, they can be done in a separate commit or pull request.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,14 +59,17 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.start_node(1)
         assert old_tx_hash in new_node.getrawmempool()
 
-        self.log.info("Add unbroadcasted tx to mempool on new node and shutdown")
-        unbroadcasted_tx_hash = new_node.sendtoaddress(recipient, 0.0001)
+        self.log.info("Add unbroadcasted tx to mempool on new node")
+        unbroadcasted_tx_hash = new_wallet.send_self_transfer(from_node=new_node)['txid']
         assert unbroadcasted_tx_hash in new_node.getrawmempool()
         mempool = new_node.getrawmempool(True)
         assert mempool[unbroadcasted_tx_hash]['unbroadcast']
-        self.stop_node(1)
 
-        self.log.info("Move mempool.dat from new to old node")
+        self.log.info("Sync the nodes and move mempool.dat from new to old node and shutdown")
+        self.start_node(0, ['-nowallet'])
+        self.connect_nodes(0, 1)
+        self.sync_blocks()
comments.body: Would be nice to move up the sync where the blocks are generated to not accidentally change what the test is testing and preserving previous test behavior
